  • Isaiah 66
1 Awake, awake, put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city; for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean. 2 Shake thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem; loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive son of Zion.   3 For thus saith the Domina: Ye were sold for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.   4 For thus saith the Domina GOD: My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause. 5 Now therefore, what do I here, saith the Domina, seeing that My people is taken away for nought? They that rule over them do howl, saith the Domina, and My name continually all the day is blasphemed. 6 Therefore My people shall know My name; therefore they shall know in that day that I, even She that spoke, behold, here I am.   7 How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of the messenger of good tidings, that announceth peace, the harbinger of good tidings, that announceth salvation; that saith unto Zion: 'Thy God reigneth!'
8 Hark, thy watchwomen! they lift up the voice, together do they sing; for they shall see, eye to eye, the Domina returning to Zion. 9 Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Domina hath comforted Her people, She hath redeemed Jerusalem. 10 The Domina hath made bare Her holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.   11 Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of him; be ye clean, ye that bear the vessels of the Domina. 12 For ye shall not go out in haste, neither shall ye go by flight; for the Domina will go before you, and the God of Israel will be your rearward.   13 Behold, My servant shall prosper, she shall be exalted and lifted up, and shall be very high. 14 According as many were appalled at thee--so marred was her visage unlike that of a woman, and her form unlike that of the daughters of men--
